metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2850 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component of OracleVirtualization (subcomponent: Core). Supported versions that are affectedare Prior to 5.2.32 and prior to 6.0.10. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure whereOracle VM VirtualBox executes to compromise Oracle VM VirtualBox.Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than theattacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) ofOracle VM VirtualBox. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 2.8 (Availability impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2850` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-dkms - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-qt - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
virtualbox-source - 6.1.18-dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.18-dfsg-5').
